channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16774] [shell] Add coverage to TestShell when ZooKeeper is not reachable
item.description: While testing a couple of things in master I noticed that after some of the changes done in HBASE-16117 the hbase shell would die when there is no ZooKeeper server up or if we get another ZK exception. This is to add coverage to test the shell when ZK is not up or if we get another exception.
item.summary: [shell] Add coverage to TestShell when ZooKeeper is not reachable

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
The v6 version of the patch in HBASE-16117 fixed this problem with manual testing. Esteban is writting a test case for this.

We will combine and submit a patch.

-1 overall

This message was automatically generated.

Reduced the test to only check if no exceptions where raised by running setup_hbase.


define_test "start_hbase_shell_no_cluster" do

      assert_nothing_raised do

        setup_hbase

      end

 end

However there is a caveat to commit this test: it will fail until HBASE-16117 gets committed.
New patch, merges changes made by Jonathan Hsieh

A few nits in the ruby parts:


54	  @Test

55	  public void testRunNoClusterShellTests() throws IOException {

56	    // Start ruby tests without cluster

57	    // System.setProperty("shell.test", "test_connection_no_cluster.rb"); // REMOVE THIS LINE?

58	    jruby.runScriptlet(PathType.ABSOLUTE, "src/test/ruby/no_cluster_tests_runner.rb");

59	  }

Add comment near top of no_cluster_tests_runner.rb saying intent of file (e.g. for testing shell with hbase is not up, pulling in all *no_cluster tests from dir xxx)

otherwise ruby parts look good to me.

Hey Esteban Gutierrez, is the TestRSStatusServlet failure here legit or is it a flaky?
TestRSStatusServlet has been flakey for a while and if I run the tests locally TestRSStatusServlet doesn't fail.

FAILURE: Integrated in Jenkins build HBase-Trunk_matrix #1810 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-Trunk_matrix/1810/)
